head.title: National Briefing | Northwest: Washington: Aids Cases Rise

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Northwest: Washington: Aids Cases Rise

abstract.p: Washington State records first increase in number of AIDS cases since 1993; most pronounced rise occurs among women and minority populations (S)

block.p: The number of AIDS cases in Washington has increased for the first time since 1993, state epidemiologists reported, with the increases especially pronounced among women and members of minorities. There were 385 cases reported in the state last year, compared with 364 in 1999. State officials said the new numbers indicated that prevention awareness was slipping. In the early stages of the AIDS epidemic in the state, women made up about 5 percent of all cases; they are now 14 percent. And African-Americans, once about 8 percent of the caseload, now represent 16 percent.

The number of AIDS cases in Washington has increased for the first time since 1993, state epidemiologists reported, with the increases especially pronounced among women and members of minorities. There were 385 cases reported in the state last year, compared with 364 in 1999. State officials said the new numbers indicated that prevention awareness was slipping. In the early stages of the AIDS epidemic in the state, women made up about 5 percent of all cases; they are now 14 percent. And African-Americans, once about 8 percent of the caseload, now represent 16 percent.
